author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md) and the [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). The following guidelines were not met:

- Repo URL does not end with /name.jl.git, where name is the package name
- There is no compat entry for `julia`.
- The following dependencies do not have a `[compat]` entry that is upper-bounded and only includes a finite number of breaking releases: Dictionaries, Glob, Graphs, ITensors, NamedGraphs
- No licenses detected in the package's top-level folder. An OSI-approved license is required.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simply retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. Then, send a message to the `#pkg-registration` channel in the [Julia Slack](https://julialang.org/slack/) to ask for help. Include a link to this pull request.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

[noblock]

Some of the AutoMerge guidelines it claims are not being met are met?
There are compat entries for all of those packages and a LICENSE file in the repo?

Also I am not sure how to edit the Repo URL at this point? Should I close this and re-register?

[noblock]

The reason for the AutoMerge disconnect is that you can see in the description at the top:

> Commit: 7f91ebc6869b5000ba392fd2a868e7095065b29a

which is the commit before you added license and compat. Now why that commit was registered is a mystery to me; it doesn't seem to match your registrator invocation. Maybe Registrator became confused by a repo name change?

My best suggestion is to try to trigger registrator again from the latest commit. It's more likely that it updates your other PR, which is fine.

[noblock]
The repo URL is actually really weird:

> repo = "https://github.com/JoeyT1994/ITensorNumericalAnalysis.jl?tab=readme-ov-file.git"

Yeah not sure why the REPO URL is so wrong. I just tried to retriever the Registrator from my latest commit: https://github.com/JoeyT1994/ITensorNumericalAnalysis.jl/commit/e8425503767ef801f35599e4d6740a1e48c3c485 so hopefully that works?

[noblock]

[noblock]

Did you by any chance do your registrations through the GitHub web page? If that's the case my guess is that you pasted a bad URL on the second attempt. I see you have a ` @JuliaRegistrator register` comment in https://github.com/JoeyT1994/ITensorNumericalAnalysis.jl/commit/e8425503767ef801f35599e4d6740a1e48c3c485#comments but if you haven't activated Registrator for your account that won't do anything.

[noblock]

Yes I did the registration via there, so that seems to be where the issue came from.

Okay let me activate Registrator for my account and recommend.

[noblock]

I activated the Registrator for my account and made a new commit, tag and release to try to register (see https://github.com/JoeyT1994/ITensorNumericalAnalysis.jl/commit/6af5036719368246d84dc3db423cd59810163417) and it gives me the error "Tag with name v0.1.0 already exists and points to a different commit".

Not sure I understand what is going wrong here, I changed the tag to v0.1.2 to try to avoid that.

[noblock] 

I guess when I call the Registrator it is trying to update this PR instead of making a new one?

Maybe if we close this one and I prompt it again it will make a new one and everything works?

[noblock]
No, Registrator is referring to the v0.1.0 tag in your repository, which you can see here: https://github.com/JoeyT1994/ITensorNumericalAnalysis.jl/tags. That is pointing to another commit than you are trying to register.

The general idea is that you shouldn't make a tag in your repository until after the registration is complete, a task which the TagBot action can help you with.

Okay I removed the tags and releases so the Registrator starts from scratch. A new PR has been created.

So this can be closed.

body:
- Registering package: ITensorNumericalAnalysis
- Repository: https://github.com/JoeyT1994/ITensorNumericalAnalysis.jl
- Created by: @JoeyT1994
- Version: v0.1.0
- Commit: 7f91ebc6869b5000ba392fd2a868e7095065b29a
- Git reference: v0.1.0
title: New package: ITensorNumericalAnalysis v0.1.0
